alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Morgan (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 07 at 12:55PM EDT until September 07 at 1:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... North central Frederick County in northwestern Virginia... Morgan County in the Panhandle of West Virginia... Northern Berkeley County in the Panhandle of West Virginia... * Until 130 PM EDT. * At 1255 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Greenwood, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Martinsburg, Greenwood, Berkeley Springs, Berkeley, Hedgesville, Johnsons Mill, Tomahawk, Johnsontown, Valley View, Spohrs Crossroads, Oakland, Rock Gap, Smith Crossroads, Jones Springs, Unger, New Hope, Shady Grove, Cherry Run, Glengary, and Omps. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
